caption.p:
Case fatality ratios (CFRs) for COVID-19 by select countries as of April 22, 2020. Data were obtained from Worldometer.
62 The case fatality ratio was calculated as the ratio of total deaths per total number of laboratory confirmed cases. Dependent on the country both numbers can be underestimated. COVID-19 cases were normalized to total cases/1 million population. (A) The graph illustrates that CFR is not a constant; some countries have a low percentage CFR in relation to a high number of cases, while other countries have a high CFR as compared to their total number of cases. (B) As shown here for the US, the CFR of a country can change within a relatively short period of time as the number of cases increases. This could be due to an overwhelmed healthcare system where personnel, hospital beds, and life-saving supplies become limiting.
